description: This Dart source file defines multiple Flutter widget screens for a cinematic TV interface application, including details, search, watchlist, and settings screens. It includes UI layout, focus management for D-pad navigation, and interactions such as search and list management.

classes.name: DetailsScreen
classes.description: A stateless widget that displays detailed information about a media item, including title, overview, and action buttons.

classes.name: _DetailsButtons
classes.description: A stateful widget managing focus nodes for 'Play' and 'Add to Watchlist' buttons in the details view.

classes.name: SearchScreen
classes.description: A stateful widget providing a search interface with focusable search field and recent results or search outcomes.

classes.name: _SearchFieldsState
classes.description: State management for SearchScreen, handling focus nodes, search results, and interactions.

classes.name: WatchlistScreen
classes.description: A stateless widget displaying user's watchlist with focusable remove buttons for each item.

classes.name: _WatchlistRow
classes.description: Stateful widget representing each row in the watchlist, including focus management and removal.

classes.name: SettingsScreen
classes.description: A stateful widget presenting a list of settings options with focus states and activate actions.

classes.name: _SettingsTile
classes.description: A widget for individual setting option with focus effects and activation callback.

classes.name: _SearchFieldStub
classes.description: A focusable search input stub used within SearchScreen for D-pad interaction.

classes.name: _SearchFieldStubState
classes.description: State for managing focus, hover, press effects in the search field stub.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds widget UI for each screen in their respective classes.

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Disposes focus nodes in focus-aware widgets to prevent memory leaks.

methods.name: _runSearch
methods.description: Executes search and updates results list within SearchScreen State.

methods.name: onActivate
methods.description: Callback invoked when a focusable widget is activated (e.g., via D-pad).
